update.description:
Convert tsv specification of tunnel system to dot topological graph.

Artifacts and blockers are ignored.

Constraints were required for 2x2 blocks and 3x3 blocks, otherwise all cells are densely connected. 2 x 2 case: Corner tunnel\_tile\_2 required hard-coded constraint dependent on mesh orientation. 3 x 3 case: Linear tiles \(tunnel\_tile\_\[5 | 6 | 7\], constrained\_tunnel\_tile\_\[tall | short\]\) required constraint dependent on mesh orientation - straight tiles are only allowed to be neighbors if they are in a straight line \(e.g. excludes parallel non-intersecting straight tiles\).

Heuristic for cost: straight to straight tile 1, straight to turn tile 3, turn tile to turn tile 3.
update.title: Topological map from tsv to dot

pull_request.title: Topological map from tsv to dot

pullrequest.title: Topological map from tsv to dot

content.raw:
Merging. DOT files generated by this script have been `diff`ed to show no difference from those generated by the latest version in ignition branch, which have now been tested with DAT generation.

Base station is now at index 0, so all tile indices are shifted \+1.
content.html:
Merging. DOT files generated by this script have been diffed to show no difference from those generated by the latest version in ignition branch, which have now been tested with DAT generation.

Base station is now at index 0, so all tile indices are shifted +1.

pullrequest.title: Topological map from tsv to dot

content.raw:
I added the consideration of blockers in `check_blocker_tile_connection()`.

I tested the example file you sent me, there is no more link between the two 4-way intersections \(`tunnel_tile_1`\).  
Assuming it is saved to `dense_map_w_blocker.tsv`, test with:

```
python3 tile_tsv.py dense_map_w_blocker.tsv --graph-file dense_map_w_blocker.dot --world-file dense_map_w_blocker.sdf
dot -Tpdf dense_map_w_blocker.dot -o dense_map_w_blocker.pdf
evince dense_map_w_blocker.pdf &
```

and the original `tunnel_qual` to make sure nothing is broken:

```
python3 tile_tsv.py tunnel_qual.tsv --world-name tunnel_qual --scale_x 20 --scale_y 20 --scale_z 5 --x0 20 --y0 240 --z0 -10 --world-file tunnel_qual_test.world --graph-file tunnel_qual_test.dot 
diff tunnel_qual.dot tunnel_qual_test.dot
```
content.html:
I added the consideration of blockers in check_blocker_tile_connection().

I tested the example file you sent me, there is no more link between the two 4-way intersections (tunnel_tile_1).
Assuming it is saved to dense_map_w_blocker.tsv, test with:

python3 tile_tsv.py dense_map_w_blocker.tsv --graph-file dense_map_w_blocker.dot --world-file dense_map_w_blocker.sdf
dot -Tpdf dense_map_w_blocker.dot -o dense_map_w_blocker.pdf
evince dense_map_w_blocker.pdf &

and the original tunnel_qual to make sure nothing is broken:

python3 tile_tsv.py tunnel_qual.tsv --world-name tunnel_qual --scale_x 20 --scale_y 20 --scale_z 5 --x0 20 --y0 240 --z0 -10 --world-file tunnel_qual_test.world --graph-file tunnel_qual_test.dot 
diff tunnel_qual.dot tunnel_qual_test.dot

pull_request.title: Topological map from tsv to dot

pullrequest.title: Topological map from tsv to dot

content.raw:
Fixed a bug related to python2/3. Python3 sorts dictionary keys automatically, Python2 doesn't, so vertex numbers needed 1.`abs()`, and 2. sorting, to make edge outputs and PDF pretty.

`test_topo_tsv.dot` committed. For easier diffing, since the vertex numbers are all different, highlighting `tile_5:` in search results helps.

Changed base station tile label to `BaseStation`. The next one still starts at 1, since tile 0 is base. The original `.dot`file had base as tile 4, so the next one started as tile 0.

In the original `tunnel_qual.dot`, vertex 7 does not exist. hence the off-by-one.

The total number of vertices is the same, even though `tunnel_qual.dot` ends at 119 and the new `.dot` ends at 109. This is because the original `.dot` did not have vertices 7, 26, 28, 29, 31, 32, 70, 71, 79, and 103, total of 10 vertices, which accounts for the difference in count. For a rigorous diff, one could do a thorough string replacement of these offsets.
content.html:
Fixed a bug related to python2/3. Python3 sorts dictionary keys automatically, Python2 doesn't, so vertex numbers needed 1.abs(), and 2. sorting, to make edge outputs and PDF pretty.

test_topo_tsv.dot committed. For easier diffing, since the vertex numbers are all different, highlighting tile_5: in search results helps.

Changed base station tile label to BaseStation. The next one still starts at 1, since tile 0 is base. The original .dotfile had base as tile 4, so the next one started as tile 0.

In the original tunnel_qual.dot, vertex 7 does not exist. hence the off-by-one.

The total number of vertices is the same, even though tunnel_qual.dot ends at 119 and the new .dot ends at 109. This is because the original .dot did not have vertices 7, 26, 28, 29, 31, 32, 70, 71, 79, and 103, total of 10 vertices, which accounts for the difference in count. For a rigorous diff, one could do a thorough string replacement of these offsets.
